entities.name: Harry
entities.description: The main character in the story, referred to as 'he' and 'him'. The text describes his actions and thoughts throughout the passage.

entities.name: the doe
entities.description: A deer-like creature that Harry sees, which is described as having an imprint on its body. The text mentions that the imprint fades away with every blink of Harry's eyes.

entities.name: she
entities.description: A female character who is mentioned in the passage as being present and leading Harry to a spot in the forest. Her presence is described as meaning safety for Harry.

entities.name: the wand
entities.description: An object that Harry uses to light up his surroundings. The text describes him whispering 'Lumos' and the wand-tip igniting.

entities.name: the forest
entities.description: The setting of the story, where Harry is standing and listening to sounds. The text mentions distant crackles of twigs and soft swishes of snow.

entities.name: the tree
entities.description: A tree that is mentioned in the passage as being behind which a flash of green light might burst from.

entities.name: the pool
entities.description: A small, frozen pool that Harry sees and examines with his wand. The text describes its cracked black surface glinting in the light.

relationships.description: Harry sees the imprint of the doe on its body, which fades away with every blink of his eyes.
She leads Harry to a spot in the forest, where he becomes disoriented and fearful.
Harry uses his wand to light up his surroundings and examine the pool.
Harry is standing in the forest, listening to sounds and examining his surroundings.
